text: Three times a year all your men are to appear before the LORD your God in the place He will choose: at the Feast of Unleavened Bread,16:16 That is, the seven-day period after the Passover during which no leaven may be eaten; see Exodus 12:14â€“20. the Feast of Weeks,16:16 That is, Shavuot, the late spring feast of pilgrimage to Jerusalem; it is also known as the Feast of Harvest (see Exodus 23:16) or the Feast of Pentecost (see Acts 2:1). and the Feast of Tabernacles.16:16 That is, Sukkot, the autumn feast of pilgrimage to Jerusalem; also translated as the Feast of Booths or the Feast of Shelters and originally called the Feast of Ingathering (see Exodus 23:16 and Exodus 34:22). No one should appear before the LORD empty-handed.
